The subject of pitbull restraint was raised today in a urlLink blog I frequently read. The author was quite upset over the fact that she, as a pitbull owner, would be required to muzzle their pet while in public due to a hastily enacted city ordinance. The whole episode stems from a urlLink vicious attack by an aggressive pitbull on another dog and several police officers. The dog being attacked was killed and at least one of the officers was sent to the hospital. While any dog that is mistreated can become aggressive and pose a public danger, we have seen time and time again that pitbulls, due to their tendancy for relentless attacks when provoked, are especially dangerous. But is it necessary to single out a particular breed because of this tendancy?? This knee-jerk legislation does so, which is what has so many responsible pit-bull owners upset. Why can't officials focus on individual incidents instead of punishing a whole group of dog owners? When an attack occurs, the animal must be euthanized and charges of negligence considered for the owner. Strict enforcement for individual offenses would be a better course of action than the shoot-from-the-hip antics we witnessed from legislators today.
